  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60742].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA only offers the user the possibility to download an attachment upon preview.
However, it would be good to have a "print" button, so there's no need to download the file in order to print.

Screenshot for clarification:
!PreviewAttachment.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide option to Print attachment in JIRA attachment preview

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Accessing the topmost comment of an issue through a direct (permalink) link fails to expand the comments.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue with 10+ comments;
# Expand the _Show xx older comments_ section;
# Copy the permalink to the topmost comment;
# Open a new tab and try to access the permalink.

* Check  [^comment_link_bug_converted.mp4]  for the detailed replication steps.

h3. Expected Results
All comments would be expanded, and the topmost comment would be highlighted.

h3. Actual Results
The comment and the _Show xx older comments_ section are not expanded.

h3. Workaround
Manually expand the comment.
fields.summary: JIRA Fails to Expand Top Comment when using Permalink
Users get lost when not logged in, bc of misleading warning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When copying a JIRA dashboard it does not copy Confluence Page Gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence;
# Create a new Dashboard in JIRA;
# Add the Confluence Page Gadget into the recently created Dashboard.
# Create a copy of the Dashboard in JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
* To be able to view the Confluence Page Gadget on the copied Dashboard in JIRA.


h3. Actual Results
* The Dashboard is copied, however it does not include the Confluence Page Gadget as per screenshot below.

*Original Dashboard*
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-22 at 3.07.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*Copied Dashboard*
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-22 at 3.08.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Copying a JIRA Dashboard does not copy the Confluence Page Gadget

h3.Workaround

Using Chrome or Firefox click on the *X* icon to delete the Application Link, right click on the *Confirm* button, click on *Inspect Element* and locate  the following string:

{quote}
<button class="button-panel-button wizard-submit" disabled="disabled">. 
{quote}

Remove the *disabled="disabled"* (right click on it and hit delete) and click on *Confirm* again, the Application Link should be deleted properly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60737].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At this moment it is not easily possible to switch easily between JIRA workflow versions. When workflows are changed, there is only the possibility to copy them and then write a version number or label into the name label (or the description of course).

h3. Suggested Solution
 
What we would like to have, is a version control for the workflows. So there should be a distinct field "version" or something similar. In Addition a function to revert to the last version (or any version prior to the current version) is also nice.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator I would like to have Workflow versioning in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60733].
  {panel}

h3. +Summary+
User requests to configure the behavior of Quick Search box to allow numbers to be treated as character strings so that the search works without relying on users being aware of wildcards or quotations. The reason behind is inexperienced users are not aware of wildcards or quotations when using [Quick Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Quick+searching].

h3. +Suggestion+
When numbers are entered into the Quick Search box, if issue keys are not found, JIRA will automatically treat them as [Free-text searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Quick+searching#Quicksearching-freetextsearchingFree-textsearching].

h3. +Workaround+
Putting the numbers inside double quotes forces JIRA to treat them as character strings e.g. "123".

h3. +Related links+
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/87363/how-do-i-search-for-just-a-number-not-a-ticket-number-in-the-quick-search-box
fields.summary: Search numbers from summary, description, and comments without using wildcards or quotations in Quick Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60731].
  {panel}

As noted by some previous user suggestions, JIRA dialogs:
* Often make poor use of larger displays - restricting users to small entry fields and leaving much screen space unused (JRA-34660, JRA-40481) 
* Are not resizable or movable (JRA-37125)
* Do not provide any means for admins to customize their size/layout.

I think your users in general would be happy to see all dialogs increased in size (width), but being able to resize (or maximize) a dialog to all/most of the screen would be great!

Some particular ones that we think are too narrow:
* Create/Edit issue screen.
* Edit comment screen narrower than create issue screen (why?)
* Link issue screen (given it includes a comment box)
fields.summary: Dialog boxes should either be re-sizeable or admin configurable

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is not possible to drag non-image files to the desktop from FireFox and Internet Explorer.

h3. Environment

* FireFox 45
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to an issue with a non-image file attached (i.e a word document)
# Click document and drag to desktop

h3. Expected Results

The file should be copied to the desktop.

h3. Actual Results

The file is not allowed to be copied to the desktop.

Console error in FireFox is as follows:
{noformat}
TypeError: Argument 1 of DataTransfer.setDragImage is not an object.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

Function current works in Google Chrome

h3.Workaround
Click the attachment link for download prompt
fields.summary: Can't Drag Non-Image Files from Issue to Desktop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60727].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It has been seen customers creating Mail Handler for JIRA ServiceDesk in JIRA Core. Perhaps some because of lack of information and some because JIRA Core mail handler has more options.

At first place it seems that the setup is working fine by configuring a Core mail handler for ServiceDesk projects, but JIRA ServiceDesk project has its own configuration such as permission, notification, and also mail handler (which is tied to automation) that are tailored towards the simplicity of the Service Desk application. Therefore, customers will face different issues in future which is not very easy to find the root cause of those.

h3. Suggested Solution

Prevent users to choose ServiceDesk projects in JIRA Core incoming mail
fields.summary: Prevent Users To Create Mail Handlers For JIRA ServiceDesk In JIRA Core

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After adding Servicedesk to JIRA Core or Software whereby Servicedesk is using a license that has expired maintenance but is valid for the release, Servcedesk links are broken or not present. 


h3. Environment
* JIRA Core or Software version 7.1.4
* Servicedesk version 3.1.2
* Servicedesk license valid until 3.1.2 release *only* and not valid for 3.1.4

(i) This was the environment used for reproducing the issue on our side, but it can be present in other versions as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Software 7.1.4
# Add Servicedesk obr with version 3.1.2 from the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/version/1030010011]
# Add the license valid until 3.1.2 release


h3. Expected Results
Servicedesk should work fine as the license is valid


h3. Actual Results
Servicedesk links are missing and Servicedesk stops working.
There is no error in the logs.
 
h3. Workaround
Use an evaluation license for the meantime.
fields.summary: Adding a Servicedesk license (valid for the release but with expired maintenance) to a JIRA instance breaks Servicedesk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Two dimensional filter statistics gadget fails when YAxis is a Custom Field restricted to certain issue types

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a custom field restricted to certain Issue Types (using the "Configure" action on the custom field).
# Configure a Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget to display on its YAxis a custom field

h3. Expected Results
The gadget shows the data represented in 2 dimensions.

h3. Actual Results
The gadget displays an error and the following is found in the logs:
{code}
2016-03-30 08:55:25,931 ERROR /rest/gadget/1.0/statistics [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.jira.issue.issuetype.IssueTypeImpl cannot be cast to org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.issuetype.IssueTypeImpl cannot be cast to org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.ofbiz.GenericValueUtils.transformToStringIds(GenericValueUtils.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.ofbiz.GenericValueUtils.transformToStringIdsList(GenericValueUtils.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.statistics.AbstractCustomFieldStatisticsMapper.getSearchContextFromValue(AbstractCustomFieldStatisticsMapper.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.statistics.AbstractCustomFieldStatisticsMapper.getSearchUrlSuffix(AbstractCustomFieldStatisticsMapper.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboarditem.statistics.service.statistics.searcher.StatisticsSearcher$StatisticMapperWrappingSearchRequestAppender.appendInclusiveSingleValueClause(StatisticsSearcher.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboarditem.statistics.service.statistics.searcher.StatisticsSearcher.completeOneDimensionalSearch(StatisticsSearcher.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboarditem.statistics.service.statistics.searcher.StatisticsSearcher.completeOneDimensionalSearch(StatisticsSearcher.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboarditem.statistics.service.statistics.StatisticsServiceImpl.aggregateOneDimensionalStats(StatisticsServiceImpl.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboarditem.statistics.rest.StatisticsResource.oneDimensionalSearchWithJql(StatisticsResource.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboarditem.statistics.rest.StatisticsResource.oneDimensionalSearchForFilter(StatisticsResource.java:109)
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboarditem.statistics.rest.StatisticsResource.oneDimensionalSearch(StatisticsResource.java:77)
	... 2 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	... 18 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:178)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:73)
	... 110 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:40)
	... 72 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

This is due to a bug in com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.statistics.AbstractCustomFieldStatisticsMapper#getSearchContextFromValue:

{code}
    protected SearchContext getSearchContextFromValue(Object value) {
        [...]

        List associatedIssueTypes = customField.getAssociatedIssueTypes();  // <-- notice the generic List?
        if (associatedIssueTypes != null && !associatedIssueTypes.isEmpty() && associatedIssueTypes.get(0) != null) {
            issueTypeIds = GenericValueUtils.transformToStringIdsList(associatedIssueTypes);  //  <-- Oops! customField.getAssociatedIssueTypes now returns a List<IssueType>, not a List<GenericValue> anymore. So you cannot call GenericValueUtils.transformToStringIdsList on it. But since associatedIssueTypes is a List and not a List<GenericValue>, you don't see the error at compilation time...
        }

        [...]
    }
{code}

h3. Notes
Some customers experience this in the XAxis as well.

h3. Workaround
Set the customfield to global context.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget fails when YAxis is a Custom Field restricted to certain issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60720].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The "permission" column is showing NULL values from the "schemepermissions" table. This column seems to be normally NULL for any permission scheme apart from Default Permission Scheme or Global Permissions. Although, the table is used to track both Global and Project permissions, the permission column used to only be applicable to the global, default or inbuilt permission schemes.

h3. Suggested Solution

If JIRA can have a better table to track the Default Global Permissions or Permission Scheme value instead of leaving permission as NULL then would be great for easy to track instead of populate permission with NULL value when new Permission Scheme are created.
fields.summary: Improve the permission column values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60713].
  {panel}

h5. Problem
As [mentioned in a related bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/HCPUB-468], certain workflow transitions will not trigger a notification in HipChat. The [related documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-296093745.html] however fails to mention these exceptions and may set false expectations on how the integration works at the moment.

h5. Proposed solution
Mention the related bug and the effect of it on the integration as a note to avoid confusion, until the bug is fixed: [Configuring JIRA with HipChat|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-296093745.html].
fields.summary: Documentation request: Mention exceptions where JIRA events do not trigger notifications in HipChat

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Active Object health-check fails after restart when Oracle is used. Initialisation of AO data is too slow and take more then 5 seconds. Subsequent health-check calls use cached data and doesn't show any problem.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7
* Database: Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.1.0
* Health-check plugins:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Atlassian HealthCheck Common Module     : com.atlassian.healthcheck.atlassian-healthcheck
Version      : 3.0.1

Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Instance Health Plugin : com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin
Version     : 2.1.7

Support Healthcheck Plugin                : com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.support-healthcheck-plugin
Version      : 2.0.6
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restart JIRA
# Login to JIRA
# Execute health-check

h3. Expected Results
All checks are fine

h3. Actual Results
UI error:
 !JIRA_AO_check.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2016-04-17 22:36:12,636 Caesium-1-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner     [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] getService bundle [com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.support-healthcheck-plugin]
2016-04-17 22:36:19,964 Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'JiraPluginScheduler:com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.scheduler.HealthCheckRunnerImpl:job' failed
java.util.concurrent.CancellationException
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:121)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.getHealthCheckStatus(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.access$000(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager$1.apply(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager$1.apply(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:92)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists$TransformingRandomAccessList$1.transform(Lists.java:617)
	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.toArray(AbstractCollection.java:141)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList.copyOf(ImmutableList.java:258)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.api.model.HealthCheckStatusReport.<init>(HealthCheckStatusReport.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.api.model.HealthCheckStatusReport.<init>(HealthCheckStatusReport.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.api.model.HealthCheckStatusReport$Builder.build(HealthCheckStatusReport.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.HealthCheckServiceImpl.runChecks(HealthCheckServiceImpl.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.scheduler.HealthCheckJob.execute(HealthCheckJob.java:39)
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
See related https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60711

Thread-dumps indicates that healthcheck stuck in:
{code}
        at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.querydsl.schema.DefaultSchemaProvider.tablesToSchema(DefaultSchemaProvider.java:131)
{code}
another possible place could be:
{code}
        at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.querydsl.schema.DefaultSchemaProvider.tableColumnNames
{code}

The code that executes slowly on oracle is:
{code}
connection.getMetaData().getTables((String) null, (String) null, (String) null, (String[]) null);
{code}

h3.Workaround
* Upgrade the [JIRA Instance Health Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin/server/overview] to version 2.1.12 or later. The ActiveObjects health check was removed.
* If you can't upgrade for any reason, it's safe to ignore the error as long the follow health-check run doesn't show any problem

fields.description:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use slow executed health-check. This could be ActiveObjects health-check with Oracle or Lucene at heavy loaded system
# Execute health-check

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

If a user mentions themselves in a JIRA issue they should not be notified.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60707].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Based on this document: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/advanced-searching-179442050.html#AdvancedSearching-Type

'was' is not a valid operator for issuetype

h3. Suggested Solution
Add 'was' operator for issue type as this would allow reporting on past issue types. 

h3. Workaround 
Using the the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin it's possible to use the Copy Value From Other Field Post-Function, allowing JIRA to be setup in the following manner:

    Remove the Issue Type field from the default screen scheme, disabling users ability to edit an issue type normally.
    Add a workflow step to change the issue type.
    This step will use the JIRA Suite Utilities post-function to set the old Issue Type in the Custom Field.
fields.summary: Add 'was' operator to issuetype for JQL search
Support for DKIM

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60705].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Most JIRA fields do not display unless they have data populated. JIRA should offer the ability to force a field to display no matter what

h3. Environment
Cloud / Server


h3. Expected Results
When creating a field or editing the properties of an existing field, the user should be able to check a box that forces the field to always display


h3. Actual Results
There is no option to do this. Subsequently fields with no data do not display unless they are required.
fields.summary: Allow forcing of fields to display within screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}


h3. Summary
When adding custom fields to a secondary tab, these fields should always show up, even without data populated

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new project or edit an existing project
# Edit the Create, Edit, or Resolve screen for the project
# Add a second tab to the screen and add custom fields to the tab

h3. Expected Results
Since fields on the secondary tab are not displayed by default, custom fields added should be displayed even without data populated

h3. Actual Results
Custom fields are not displayed if they have no data populated in them
fields.summary: Custom fields should be displayed on secondary tabs regardless of data

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating create, view, and resolve screens for projects, system level fields are mixed with custom fields. This becomes confusing as some 'system level fields' are actually treated as custom fields and show as custom fields within JIRA e.g., Epic Link, Sprint

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Expected Results
System level fields should display on their own tab

h3. Actual Results
System level fields are mixed with custom fields on the default tab
fields.summary: Display system level fields on their own tab in workflow screens

fields.description: The documentation at [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.1.4/#api/2/reindex] (7.1.4) and [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/6.4.12/#d2e2647] (6.4.12) does not include the possible values for the type field on POST. You can infer that at least BACKGROUND_PREFERRED and FOREGROUND are possible strings by looking at the example and the default value, but it's not indicated whether those are the only options or if any others exist.
fields.summary: Documentation for reindex REST API does not include list of strings available for type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking the "wheel button" of a mouse, links normally opens in a new tab. However, this doesn't work when in *Detail View* of Issue Navigator with Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up new instance and create some issues
# Access JIRA using Chrome
# Navigate to the Issue Navigator with *Detail View*
# In the _left hand panel_ where they list the issues, click on one of them using the middle "wheel button"

h3. Expected Results
The issue is opened in a new tab

h3. Actual Results
It will behave as if the left mouse button is used to click on it. The issue will open in the same tab, and the _right hand panel_ will display the details of the issue

h3. Notes
* It works fine in Firefox. Issue will be opened in a new tab. Only misbehaving in Chrome. Did not test with IE and Safari
* In JIRA 6.4.12, it behaves correctly and the issue opens in a new tab. 
* Other than the "wheel button", same behaviour applies when clicking *CTRL + Left Mouse Button*

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: "Wheel button" of a mouse doesn't open issues in new tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60695].
  {panel}

Case:
* open an Issue
* start editing the description, directly on Issue page
* write something there
* press ESC (accidentally). While i say accidentally is because in my case some other application (not web) popped up (e.g. outlook notification popup) and i wanted to ESC-close that popup. When pressing ESC the popup was closed but chrome's JIRA page also received that event so it also canceled my whole editing.

Suggestion: when pressing ESC in quick editing mode, if i edited something, pls ask me first, before cancelling.
fields.summary: While editing the Issue description, ask me when i accidentally press ESC

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
 * Create an Applink between JIRA and FishEye
 * Make sure that Display URL and Application URL are different
 !applink.png|thumbnail!
 * Create a branch and a commit on a JIRA issue

h5. Scenario A
 * 
 ** On a branch page, hover the mouse on the _Create Review_ link and see the URL at the bottom

h5. Scenario B
 * 
 ** On a Commit page, hover the mouse on the _Create Review_ link and see the URL at the bottom

h4. Expected Behaviour
 * Display URL should be displayed on both scenarios

h4. Actual Behaviour
 * When creating a review from the branch, the Application URL is being displayed instead of Display URL which is *not* the case when creating a review on a commit.
 !branch.png|thumbnail!
 !commit.png|thumbnail!

h4. Environment:

JIRA 7.1.4 and FishEye 4.0.2

h4. Notes

The problem is happening to *Create Branch* option to Bitbucket 4.14.3 server.
fields.summary: Application URL is being shown instead of the Display URL when creating a Review on a Branch

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60693].
  {panel}

Jira Version: v7.0.2
Tomcat 7

We has use OWASP to scan JIRA server and generate report.
The report show some risk on JIRA as below:
1. X-Frame-Options Header Not Set
2. Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set
3. Cookie set without HttpOnly flag
4. Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled
5. Password Autocomplete in browser
6. X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

How to solve this problem?
Which JIRA version doesn't have this problem?
fields.summary: X-Frame-Options Header Risk (scan from OWASP)
Braces not rendered correctly

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Perform an advanced search, viewing the results in the List View
# Click on an issue (takes you to the issue)
# Click back on the browser button (takes you back to the issue search)

*Observed result*
The "Search issues" and "Query Profile" buttons are duplicated. With each repeat of the "click into an issue - click back button" cycle, the page gets more broken - eventually becoming unresponsive. 

*Expected result*
Search interface doesn't change.

*Additional notes*
* +If a user doesn't have access to view the Query Profile, the bug does not occur+
* Occurring on both Mac & PC
* Occurring on both Google Chrome & Mozilla Firefox
* Screenshot is attached
fields.summary: Returning to Issue Search using browser back button breaks search interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60690].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attaching images using CTRL + V does not consistently bring up the Attach Screenshot popup dialogue to allow upload. 

h3. Environment
* Windows OS  
* Safari OS
* Firefox - Inconsistent
* Chrome - Inconsistent
* IE 11 - Inconsistent

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an Issue
# Copy an image to your clipboard
# Click on JIRA to bring the page in focus
# Use CTRL+ V to attach image
# If the Attach ScreenShot dialogue pops, click Cancel and repeat step 4
# If no dialogue box appears repeat step 4 (In Firefox and IE, this may take 15+ pastes)

h3. Another Step to Reproduce
# During issue transition, if there is a popup screen with comment box configured and shown. We are allowed to CTRL + V to paste an image into it.
# If *attachment* field is not available on the transition screen, the image will not be uploaded when we paste it using CTRL + V.
# Once the comment posted, the pasted image will show as broken image icon due to its files did not upload into JIRA issue ticket.
# As a workaround, we need to include *attachment* field onto these transition screen to ensure the image successfully upload.

h3. Expected Results
On first CTRL+V the Attach ScreenShot dialogue should appear and the copied image will be shown in the dialogue


h3. Actual Results
Attach ScreenShot Dialogue randomly appears, if it appears at all. The following error message can be found in the Network Profiler
{noformat}
SyntaxError: JSON.parse: unexpected end of data at line 1 column 1 of the JSON data
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
Attach Image by either the Drag and Drop method or by clicking More > Attach File
fields.summary: Attaching Images with Keyboard Shortcuts (Ctrl + V) into Issues is Inconsistent/Broken

fields.description:
One of our users keeps getting blocked and cannot login to create tickets because of this issue. He gets the message "Sorry, you are requested to answer a CAPTCHA question correctly." but there is no CAPTCHA question showing on the screen! See attached screenshot.

More info:  we are on Windows 2012 Server R2, Apache Tomcat (= default), PostgreSQL (= default), self-hosted and we are on version 3.0.10.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Index corrupted when administrator trigger a shutdown on a node. *The index continue to be broken after the restart and JIRA did not automatically recover the index*, causing continuous error of {{FileNotFoundException}} spamming the log.

h3. Environment
JIRA Data Center 6.4.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Restarting the node gracefully ({{./stop-jira.sh}} or {{./shutdown.sh}}) while JIRA is performing index update for issue update/change.

h3. Expected Results
No error thrown and index should work after restart.

h3. Actual Results
Index got corrupted before JIRA complete shutting down and unable to recover itself after the restart. 

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /usr/local/test/user/atlassian/jira/data/caches/indexes/issues/_skx8_l.del (No such file or directory)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open0(Native Method)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(RandomAccessFile.java:316)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(RandomAccessFile.java:243)
        at org.apache.lucene.store.MMapDirectory.openInput(MMapDirectory.java:214)
        at org.apache.lucene.store.FSDirectory.openInput(FSDirectory.java:345)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.loadDeletedDocs(SegmentReader.java:158)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.get(SegmentReader.java:118)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:702)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:677)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream.applyDeletes(BufferedDeletesStream.java:249)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.doFlush(IndexWriter.java:3571)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flush(IndexWriter.java:3508)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.prepareCommit(IndexWriter.java:3371)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commitInternal(IndexWriter.java:3444)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3426)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3410)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:143)
{noformat}
This means that index entries were supposed to be deleted from an index file, but it doesn't exist. The stack trace is very similar to the one in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41409, but this one died 4 lines later in SegmentReader.get. 
 
h3. Notes
Right after shutdown is triggered shown in the log, the node will hit into {{InterruptedException}} error
{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.InterruptedException
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireInterruptibly(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1220)
        at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.put(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:339)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex.perform(QueueingIndex.java:74)
        ... 34 more
{noformat}
This means that a request to index an issue was sent, but it was rejected, due to shutdown. This stack trace does not indicate index corruption, but increase its possibility. 

h3.Workaround
After the node restart, trigger *Index Copy* manually to recover a working index snapshot from another node.
fields.summary: Corrupted index not restored on JIRA Data Center startup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attach Screenshot on Firefox does not Work as expected

h3. Environment

* JIRA Version 7.1.4
* Latest Firefox browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a screenshot.
# Access JIRA Application via firefox browser
# Go to a "View Issue" page for any issue.
# Press "Control + V"

h3. Expected Results

Page to attach screenshot appear

h3. Actual Results
Page to attach screenshot do not appear most of the time. Sometimes it appears.
 
h3. Notes
In google chrome this function works well. Whenever we take a screenshot and press "Control + V" a new page to attach screenshot appears.

h3.Workaround
# Use google chrome to access JIRA and attach screenshot to an issue.
# In firefox press comment and press "Control + V" to open page to attach the screenshot on an issue.
fields.summary: Screenshot attachment on Firefox does not Work as expected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60659].
  {panel}

*Feature Summary*

When JIRA loads and certain add-ons are disabled or have modules disabled. Can a warning similar to the wrong collation pop-up that appears on the right hand panel be shown alerting them to this?

This is particularly useful if the plugin in question provides features to workflows and they being disabled could lead to various problems.

Admins seeing such warnings on the UI can simply proceed to fix the issue.
fields.summary: Warn an Admin that a plugin failed to load or is disabled in JIRA UI

fields.description:
In Jira it is not possible to create a user with a email address with a IDN domain.

For example, it is not possible to create the user with the mail address test@exämple.com (Of course, you could enter test@xn--exmple-cua.com, but this defeats the whole purpose of internationalized domain names: Easiness of use).
The mail address should be converted to Punycode in this masked or internally be saved in UTF-8 completely.

As a side node, with the SMTPUTF8 smtp extension, it is also possible to create mail addresses where the local part contains UTF8, e.g. täst@exämple.com. This should also be made possible.

See also issue JRA-41113.
fields.summary: Not able to create user with IDN mail address

  {panel}

Hi All:

I'd like to be able to use \{code:yaml\} like I can use \{code:xml\}. 

Over at Apache, we are on version v6.3.4#6332-sha1:51bc225.

Right now, I get a "Unable to find source-code formatter for language: yaml. Available languages are: actionscript, html, java, javascript, none, sql, xhtml, xml"

Thank you,
Gary

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60653].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When configuring the filter results gadget, if there are many custom fields, the bottom of the dropdown menu can be shown off the bottom of the screen as in the screenshot below (JIRA 7.1.4 + Google Chrome)

In older versions of the product, the Dropdown menu is shown next to the gadget as below in Google Chrome, or off the screen in Firefox:

- Overly long Dropdown: 
 !long-drop7-1-4.png|thumbnail! 

- Strange menu positioning in JIRA 6.4: 
 !rendering-JIRA6-4-12.png|thumbnail! 

- Strange menu positioning in JIRA 7.1.4 (even with no results):
 !rendering-JIRA7-1-4.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment
This issue can be replicated with Google Chrome Version 49.0.2623.112 and Firefox version: 45.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a largish number of custom fields (say, 10 - 15)
# Create a new dashboard with a few gadgets, 
# Add the Filter Results Gadgets to the bottom of the dashboard and try to configure it
# Attempt to add an additional column to display. 
# Observe the positioning of the suggestions is inconstant. 
# The weird positioning behaviour is inconsistently reproducible, but the likelihood of replication increases when the gadget is first added and positioned on the dashboard. 

h3. Expected Results
# If low on screen real estate, the dropdown shouldn't render so many suggestions that the list falls off the screen. 
# The Dropdown should always show the full list, and be positioned under the dropdown text-field. 

h3. Actual Results
The location of the dropdown menu as shown is incorrectly sized and positioned as per the screenshots
fields.summary: Dropdown menu in gadgets displays incorrect location
Bulk unwatch should *also* be available so an admin can perform it for someone if necessary
Bulk unwatch should *also* be available so an admin can perform it for someone if necessary

Disabling keyboard shortcuts in the user profile has no effect.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60645].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Migration from JIRA Server to Cloud has currently this bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60588

Basically, if the user migrate from JIRA Server to Cloud and the System timezone is different, this will cause a serious problem where dates are actually changed on migration.

This can be prevented is the user, for example, creates a Cloud instance in the same timezone as the Server. However, this can only be prevented, as we don't have a good and safe way to fix this problem after the migration is done.

Letting the customers know in advance about this problem may prevent many users with the same problem.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a warning to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/migrating-from-jira-server-to-jira-cloud-779160826.html] warning the customer to this bug and asking them to make sure the timezones match.

Suggested message:
{quote}
JIRA Server to Cloud migration is current affected by the JRA-60588 bug, which may incorrectly migrate some dates.. To prevent this problem, please make sure to migrate to a JIRA Cloud using the same timezone as the source JIRA Server.
{quote}
fields.summary: Add warning to migration documentation
Leave IssueFactory.cloneIssue(Issue) as it is

fields.description:
h3. *Issue Summary*
When you perform a search relating to username fields such as assignee:
{code}assignee in ('user1'){code}
you would be able to switch between basic and advanced search modes.

However when you rename the user, should you attempt to search the same user after correcting the name, you would not be able to change back to the basic search for the user as JIRA would keep saying "The query is too complex".

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Perform the following search in issue navigator:
{code}assignee in ('user1'){code}
# Attempt to press the link to switch between basic and advanced search method
#* Expect this to succeed if the user has never been renamed.
# Rename the user from user management page.
# Go back to current search and update the username to match the change.
 

h3. *Expected Behavior*
You can change between basic and Advanced search options.

h3. *Actual Behavior* 
The link is disabled and JIRA tells you that the query is too complex.

h3. *What I have done*
I re-indexed the instance to see if this would help but it did not.
fields.summary: Renaming User Breaks Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60642].
  {panel}

Currently, when customer include the log work into the screen, the following fields are added:

* Time Spent
* Date Started
* Remaining Estimate

It would be nice to have a configuration to only allow only *Time Spent* to be shown instead of all the fields above. This applies to the customer's that only want to track the time spent on the issues without the estimations.
fields.summary: Allow Screens to only Show the Time Spent for Log Work fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60641].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*

A user has an LDAP directory behind a proxy so as to give it added security. Unfortunately with this setup, they cannot login to JIRA as it fails to authenticate the user in their Delegated LDAP directory.

h3. Expected Behavior
JIRA should be able to connect to the directory irrespective of whether it is behind a proxy or not.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to use the LDAP proxy server for the user authentication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60636].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It would be useful if a user can see that a link to another issue exists even though this linked issue cannot be opened by the stated user. A simple example is as shown below:

John works in project AAA. 
John does not work in project BBB and cannot even see the issues of project BBB.
The team leader of project BBB has linked issue AAA-23 to issue BBB-45 from project BBB.
It would be useful for John to know that AAA-23 has got a relationship to project BBB. For example: John to be able to see that BBB-45 is linked to AAA-23 even though John cannot view BBB-45.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
A feature which will enable users to view the links for the linked issues eventhough they do not have permission but when they try to click the linked issues a message stating "You do not have permission to view the issues" is displayed.
fields.summary: Issue Linking - Make the link viewable even if the user do not have permission to access the linked issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60635].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
"Give Feedback" in the JIRA Mobile app is not working

h3. Environment
JIRA iOS mobile app 1.1.0

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open the mobile app
# press the cog icon to open the settings menu
# press 'Give Feedback'
# Enter Feedback and press 'Send'
# App displays 'Sending' 

h3. Expected results
app confirms feedback has been sent

h3. Actual results
an error appears: "error sending feedback"

h3. Workaround
Log feedback in the JRA project at https://jira.atlassian.com
fields.summary: The 'Give Feedback' option in the JIRA Mobile app is not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60634].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It is not possible to review a list of unassigned tickets in the JIRA mobile app. 

h3. Suggested Solution
In addition to reviewing assigned issues, and creating issues, it would be nice to be able to review unassigned tickets

h3. Workaround
Open the desktop application to assign an issue, then it will be possible to view it in the mobile app.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to review unassigned tickets in JIRA using the mobile app

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Open the project create dialog.
# Type in a two word name in the "Name" field. Press 'tab'. The 'Key' field should autocomplete.
# Press backspace to remove all of the characters in the 'Key' field.

Then watch as the 'Key' field is regenerated. This is a bug, it should remain empty; not regenerate.
fields.summary: Project key in project create dialog is auto populated when I press backspace

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer would like to hide the Create Sub-Task and Convert to Sub-Task option from the More Menu for certain Request Types in a single project

The options are only hidden if no Sub-Tasks are used in the project

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option to disable Sub-Task creation from certain Issue Types

h3. Workaround 
Create separate projects to Track Tasks/Sub-Tasks and all others (Bugs, Features, Story)
fields.summary: Hide Create Sub-Task and Convert to Sub-Task Options for Certain Issue Types

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , when issue created via JAVA API using {{IssueService.validateCreate}} , it will not auto assign to Component Lead if it is configured at Component configuration. It will assigned to the *Project Lead* or as per configured at project level . 

The situation is similar as per describe [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/199312/creating-issues-programatically-with-automatic-component-lead-assignment-doesnt-seem-to-work-in-jira-6.1-2013062]

h3. Suggested Solution
Assign to Component Lead if it is configured .
fields.summary: Creating issue via JAVA API will assign to Component Lead if component is configured
Show modification date AND time for workflows
JIRA users should not see Confluence users' Profile Picture update in Activity Stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60622].
  {panel}

As a user, product owner, I want to quickly set the priority in large backlog (more than 1000 issues). 

My workflow:
- I receive email with notification that ticket was created
- I open the ticket and see how important it is
- Currently I can only quickly set "Rank to top" or "Rank to bottom" which is very useful. 
- *Problem: if I want to rank it somewhere in the middle, I need to click "View on board", choose a board, wait for the board to load and then drag&drop the ticket which is too slow when board has over 1000 issues.*

My idea is that you could add more button actions, like "Rank in the middle of backlog", "Rank after first 20% of tickets". Or you could have a vertical "slider" that allows to quickly set a rough rank on agile board, like a "mini-dragging".
See the screenshot.
fields.summary: Quick rank issues in the middle of the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Index corrupted when administrator trigger a shutdown on a node. The index continue to be broken after the restart and JIRA did not automatically recover the index, causing continuous error of {{FileNotFoundException}} spamming the log.

h3. Environment
JIRA Data Center 6.4.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Restarting the node gracefully ({{./stop-jira.sh}} or {{./shutdown.sh}}) while JIRA is performing index update for issue update/change.

h3. Expected Results
No error thrown and index should work after restart.

h3. Actual Results
Index got corrupted before JIRA complete shutting down and unable to recover itself after the restart. 

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /usr/local/test/user/atlassian/jira/data/caches/indexes/issues/_skx8_l.del (No such file or directory)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open0(Native Method)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(RandomAccessFile.java:316)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(RandomAccessFile.java:243)
        at org.apache.lucene.store.MMapDirectory.openInput(MMapDirectory.java:214)
        at org.apache.lucene.store.FSDirectory.openInput(FSDirectory.java:345)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.loadDeletedDocs(SegmentReader.java:158)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.get(SegmentReader.java:118)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:702)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:677)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream.applyDeletes(BufferedDeletesStream.java:249)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.doFlush(IndexWriter.java:3571)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flush(IndexWriter.java:3508)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.prepareCommit(IndexWriter.java:3371)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commitInternal(IndexWriter.java:3444)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3426)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3410)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:143)
{noformat}
This means that index entries were supposed to be deleted from an index file, but it doesn't exist. The stack trace is very similar to the one in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41409, but this one died 4 lines later in SegmentReader.get. 
 
h3. Notes
Right after shutdown is triggered shown in the log, the node will hit into {{InterruptedException}} error
{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.InterruptedException
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireInterruptibly(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1220)
        at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.put(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:339)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex.perform(QueueingIndex.java:74)
        ... 34 more
{noformat}
This means that a request to index an issue was sent, but it was rejected, due to shutdown. This stack trace does not indicate index corruption, but increase its possibility. 

h3.Workaround
After the node restart, trigger *Index Copy* manually to recover a working index snapshot from another node.
fields.summary: Shutdown corrupt the index on JIRA Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If JIRA has non-existing user in the _Administer project_ permission of the Project Permission then it stops showing top dropdown header.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Use Project Configurator plugin
# On Source:
## Create a project
## Create a user called TestUser1
## Amend the permission scheme to use this user, add as admin for project
## Export the project config with PC plugin
# On Dest
## DO NOT CREATE USER TestUser1
## Import project config via PC plugin

h3. Expected Results
It works fine

h3. Actual Results
Top dropdown page header is not present.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2016-04-14 09:51:57,891 http-bio-8443-exec-26 ERROR admin 591x87653x2 1x6uly9 127.0.0.1 /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa [webwork.util.ValueStack] METHOD: "projectAdmin", exception: 
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: parameter should not be null!
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.notNull(Assertions.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.type.SingleUser.hasPermission(SingleUser.java:150)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.type.SingleUser.hasPermission(SingleUser.java:138)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager$4.hasPermission(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:591)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.hasSchemePermission(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:844)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.hasSchemePermission(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:586)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.doProjectPermissionCheck(DefaultPermissionManager.java:361)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermission(DefaultPermissionManager.java:218)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:144)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy14.hasPermission(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.project.ViewProjects.isProjectAdmin(ViewProjects.java:98)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
....
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Problem may occurs executing other actions, eg: Issue Create. 

h3.Workaround
* Check project permission page and remove non-existing users
* Use updated version of Project Configurator plugin. The versions with the fix (*1.13.1-J6* and *1.13.1-J7*) were released 2016-06-10.
fields.summary: Non-existing user in Administer project permission breaks top dropdown header.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60619].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
# As per the [Sharing an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/emailing-an-issue-269981237.html] documentation, after typing a name/email into the "User name or email" field, a drop-down list of users/emails will be displayed. 
# If you close the drop-down list without selecting a user/email, it will state "The value xxx is invalid." where xxx is the name you have inputted. 
# This is an expected behavior because there potentially could have more than 1 results such as if you have 3 users named after typing "Adam" into the field, all 3 users are displayed. 
# When you close the dropdown list without selecting anyone, it will display "The value Adam is invalid." because JIRA is not sure which user is meant to receive the email.
# The error message will also display even if there is only one user in the drop-down list of if you typed in a non-registered user email and did not select the user/email from the drop-down list.
# This can be be confusing for some users because when they fully typed in the non-registered user email and then close the drop-down list, it will display that the email is invalid.

h3. Suggested Solution
# The UI should instead point out to the user that they have to select that the user has to select the user/email from the drop-down list. 
# JIRA should proceed to send the email anyway if there is only one result and it is valid.
fields.summary: When sharing an issue through the UI, the invalid error should be less ambiguous

h3. Problem Definition
It is troublesome to manually delete issue type schemes that are not associated to any project one by one especially if you have a huge instance that has a lot of issue type schemes. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a functionality in the UI that lets users bulk delete the unused issue type schemes.
 
h3. Workaround 
You can follow the workaround method in this KB: [How to delete issue type schemes that are not associated with any projects from the database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+delete+issue+type+schemes+that+are+not+associated+with+any+projects+from+the+database] which involves database manipulation.
fields.summary: Allow bulk deletion of Issue type schemes that are not associated with a project.

h3. Summary
Time Since Chart throws an internal server error when using a custom date field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps to Reproduce:
1) Open a dashboard.
2) Add a "Time Since Chart" gadget to the dashboard.
3) Configure the dashboard to use a custom date field.
4) Click Save.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget configuration should save and load correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The gadget configuration does not save correctly and the user encounters an error message that says, "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource."

fields.description:
This issue was reported to the JIRA "ecosystem" in February 2014 but has seen no attention there:

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/projects/CMMT/issues/CMMT-94?filter=allopenissues

We are seeing the issue with JIRA 6.4.12 and JIRA Commit Acceptance Plug-In 1.6.0. We leverage a GenericLDAP connection to a Windows Active Directory as our user directory.

We have a user that had an incorrect ID created in the Active Directory. His ID was changed there; but I'm not sure what if anything was done in JIRA. The change may well have propagated automatically. Within JIRA all the user's details look fine. But the app_user table shows that the user's user_name has been changed (the names / keys below have been changed to protect internal data):

{code:java}
SELECT * FROM JIRA_SCHEMA.app_user WHERE lower_user_name = 'george' 
ID         user_key            lower_user_name
12345   fred                    george
{code}

We are also seeing this issue with the user when we review any issues that have been assigned to him:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41216

The JIRA Commit Acceptance Plug-in rejects commits in subversion with an error similar to:

* Error     Commit rejected: No project accepts this commit. Project [*]: Issue [PROJ-1234]
* Error     must be assigned to george (George Doe)

And within atlassian-jira.log:

* [commitacceptance.server.evaluator.EvaluateService] Commit acceptance result: "false|No project accepts this commit. Project [*]: Issue [PROJ-1234] must be assigned to george (George Doe)."

The preferred solution is an update to the JIRA Commit Acceptance Plug-In to correctly leverage the new JIRA schema, i.e.: requiring that the VCS username match the JIRA "lower_user_name" from app_user and not "user_key". But we can perform the activity to synchronize the user's user_key to their user_name if you can provide details on what's required. For example, from a few years ago:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/250787/after-renaming-usernames-in-jira-6-1-4-worklogs-do-not-expand-author-correctly-in-rest-api
fields.summary: JIRA Commit Acceptance Plug-In rejects commits for users that have renamed usernames

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

*Please check https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-194129.*

I have disabled this feature in our JIRA, please let me know if you want me to enable it again.

I suggest you get just the 1st column of a Kanban workflow to be the "backlog" improvement for this feature.

I also suggest the configured swimlanes and all other columns continue working as expected.

This is a useless feature if it is going to work the way it is.

Thanks
